title: Bitan
text:
Bitan (), historically called Shi-Bitan (), is a tourist spot in <a href="Xindian%20District">Xindian District</a>, <a href="New%20Taipei">New Taipei</a>, <a href="Taiwan">Taiwan</a>. "Bitan" literally means "green lake", referring to where the <a href="Xindian%20River">Xindian River</a> widens to form the lake. There is a well-known <a href="suspension%20bridge">suspension bridge</a> that is used only by pedestrians. The bridge can be seen on the crest of Xindian. There are many restaurants, carnival activities, and <a href="Pedalo">pedal boats</a> in the area.
Transportation.
Bitan can easily be reached via Taipei's <a href="Taipei%20Metro">metro</a> system. The lake is walking distance southwest of the <a href="Xindian%20metro%20station">Xindian Station</a> (south terminal station of the green line).
